document.docAuthor: Zeng, You-Pai, Yuan, Qiong & Yang, Qin-Er
document.masterDocTitle: Thalictrum kangdingense (Ranunculaceae), a new synonym of T. megalostigma from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Thalictrum kangdingense (Ranunculaceae), a new synonym of T. megalostigma from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type :— CHINA . Sichuan : Kangtin-hsien (Tatsienlu) (= Kangding), in thickets,
9000 ‒ 9500 ft
,
27 September 1928
,
W . P . Fang 3619
( holotype GH00038599 !; isotypes E00386259 !, K000694181 !, NAS00186902 !, P00145842 !, US00103795!). Fig. 4
.

Type :— CHINA . Sichuan : Kangding , Bawanghai , in forests,
3137 m
,
17 July 2018
,
X. Y . Zhu et al. GG226
( holotype PE02293701 !). Fig. 1
.

. Inset a: flower; inset b: aggregate fruits (immature).

Thalictrum xinningense
in the wild (China, Hunan province, Xinning county, the type locality). A. Habitat. B. Habit. C. Portion of stem. D. Portion of leaf. E. Portion of inflorescence. F. Achenes (immature). Photographed by Y.P. Zeng.

Thalictrum megalostigma

T. megalostigma
, i.e. Kangding county in Sichuan province, China.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description :—Perennial herbs, glabrous throughout. Roots fibrous. Stem 40–120 cm tall. Basal leaves persistent at anthesis. Cauline leaves 2–4-ternate; leaf blade pentagonal, 7–32 cm long, 7–30 cm broad; leaflets ovate or broadly ovate, 1.5– 6 cm long, 0.7– 6 cm broad, base rounded or subcordate, apex obtuse, acute or mucronate, 3-lobate; lobes 2 ‒ 3-lobate or entire, apex rounded; nerves 5, obscure adaxially, prominent abaxially; petioles 2–15 cm long, with stipules at base; stipules oblong, membranous, margin torn. Inflorescence thyrsiform, leafy. Flowers bisexual, erect. Sepals narrowly obovate, ca. 3 mm long, margin membranous. Stamens 11 ‒ 16; filaments ca. 5 mm long, proximally filiform, distally oblanceolate-linear, white; anthers ca. 1 mm long, ovate, apex obtuse, pale yellow. Carpels 4–7, subsessile; ovary compressed-ellipsoid, smooth; style ca. 1 mm long, uncinate or circinate; stigma linear. Achene stipe ca. 0.5 mm long; body broad-ellipsoid, inconspicuously ribbed when dry; style persistent, apex recurved.
Phenology :—Flowering from June to July; fruiting from July to August.

Distribution and habitat :—
Thalictrum megalostigma
is endemic to China (southeastern Gansu and northern and western Sichuan ) ( Fig. 14 ). It grows in forests, bushes or on grassy slopes at altitudes of 1900–3200 m above sea level.

Additional specimens examined :— CHINA . Gansu : Lintan, X.G. Sun et al. 2280 (PE01801100); Tanchang, T.P. Wang 14344 (KUN0689930, PE00471247, WUK, barcode unavailable); Tewo, Q.E. Yang & H.Z. Kong 98-87 (PE00471480). Sichuan : Baoxing, K.C. Kuan & W.T. Wang 3002 (PE00450910, PE00450911); Barkam, D.E. Boufford et al. 39874 (PE01859674),
